p: Projected future climatic conditions for the year 2050 based on the IPCC 5th assessment report were used to assess the potential effects of climate change on R. ponticum habitat suitability in Snowdonia National Park. We used the following six GCMs projections: BCC-CSM1-1, CCSM4, GISS-E2-R, MIROC5, HadGEM2-ES, and MPI-ESM-LR. These are some of the most recent GCMs, also used in the Fifth Assessment IPCC report and are currently considered the most reliable GCMs for future climate projections (IPCC, 2014). The assessment was made under two Representative Concentration Pathways: RCP 4.5 and RCP 8.5. RCP 4.5 describes a scenario where GHG emissions are stabilized and thus represents a stable scenario, while RCP 8.5 is a scenario depicting an extreme situation where GHG emissions increase until 2100 (Akhter et al., 2017).
